# Full Stack Open - Course Workspace Instructions

This workspace is organized for the University of Helsinki's Full Stack Open course submissions.

## Project Structure

- Each part (part0-part13) has its own directory
- Exercises within each part should be organized in subdirectories
- Frontend projects use React, backend projects use Node.js/Express

## Development Guidelines

- Use modern JavaScript (ES6+) and TypeScript where applicable
- Follow course best practices for React components and Node.js applications
- Keep dependencies up to date within each part's projects
- Write clean, readable code with proper comments

## Course Coverage

- Part 0: Fundamentals of Web apps
- Part 1: Introduction to React
- Part 2: Communicating with server
- Part 3: Programming a server with NodeJS and Express
- Part 4: Testing Express servers, user administration
- Part 5: Testing React apps
- Part 6: Advanced state management
- Part 7: React router, custom hooks, styling app with CSS and webpack
- Part 8: GraphQL
- Part 9: TypeScript
- Part 10: React Native
- Part 11: CI/CD
- Part 12: Containers
- Part 13: Using relational databases

## Submission Guidelines

- Each exercise should be in its own folder within the part directory
- Include README files for complex exercises
- Test thoroughly before submitting
- Follow the course submission instructions
